intro: Labordia hirtella, commonly known as the hairy labordia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Labordia hirtella is often found in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in humid conditions.
